intro: Glottiphyllum arrectum, commonly known as the upright glottiphyllum, is a rare and striking member of the Aizoaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of Namibia and South Africa, where it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and fleshy, blue-green leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Its flowers, which appear in summer, are small and clustered, typically in shades of yellow and orange. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is a subject of interest for botanists and succulent enthusiasts alike.
